pull_request.title: Help Center: Show error if submitting ticket fails
pull_request.body:
#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52076348/169039433-cbce455a-8b8e-42d1-9e45-064d5df64f5e.png)

- Introduced an error shown to the user if the request for submitting to forums (as a free user) or sending an email fails.
- In FORUM and EMAIL the subject is now required, without that the request would fail.
- Moved `FormInputValidation` to `@automattic/components`, as we needed to use it from the help center package

#### Testing instructions

<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the fix.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

Don't be scared of the huge number of files, 99% is only changing the import! 

* checkout the branch
* `yarn dev --sync` from `apps/editing-toolkit`
* open the help center
* check that the subject is now required in EMAIL and FORUM
* `yarn start`
* check that there are no errors for the import changes ([http://calypso.localhost:3000/devdocs/design/form-fields](http://calypso.localhost:3000/devdocs/design/form-fields) could be a nice place to check)

<!--
Link a related issue to this PR. If the PR does not immediately resolve the issue,
for example, it requires a separate deployment to production, avoid
using the "fixes" keyword and instead attach the [Status] Fix Inbound label to
the linked issue.
-->

Related to #63552
Fixes #63552

issue.title: Status: update staging checks to support newer WPEngine staging environments

labels.name: [Type] Bug
labels.description: When a feature is broken and / or not performing as intended

labels.name: [Type] Happiness Request
labels.description: Issues or PRs that were reported via Happiness.

labels.name: [Plugin] Jetpack
labels.description: Issues about the Jetpack plugin. https://wordpress.org/plugins/jetpack/

issue.body:
### Impacted plugin

Jetpack

### Steps to Reproduce

Jetpack's default staging setup includes checks to detect WPEngine staging sites:

https://github.com/Automattic/jetpack/blob/e13487d0dbbe4c743739b6f1a3e37c143a8c2614/projects/packages/status/tests/php/test-status.php#L356-L359
https://github.com/Automattic/jetpack/blob/3e14492ded4e756ad0b7824ad31759999171da43/projects/packages/status/src/class-status.php#L192

However, those only account for one type of staging site. WPEngine now includes 2 types of staging environments. As per [their support documentation](https://wpengine.com/support/staging-environments-1-click-staging-different/):

> Legacy 1-Click Staging vs Staging/Development Environments

  | Legacy 1-Click Staging | Staging Environments
-- | -- | --
URL Structure | environment.staging.wpengine.com | environment.wpengine.com
| |  ✅ (supported by Jetpack) | 🔴 (not supported by Jetpack)

We'll need to update Jetpack to support this.


### Other information

Internal reference: 7037-gh-jpop-issues

Reported here:

- https://wordpress.org/support/topic/jetpack-is-going-safemode-on-prod-site-after-copying-site-to-staging/
- 4389012-zen

comment.body: WP Engine's new staging environment doesn't seem to have an obvious way to detect it. I've started a conversation with their technical team to determine if there's a way (or if one could be added) to detect their production vs staging vs development envs.

issue.title: [WIP]Themes: Adding alert on themes that need to be updated

labels.name: [Status] Needs Review
labels.description: The PR is ready for review. This also triggers e2e canary tests and wp-desktop tests automatically.

issue.body: #### Changes proposed in this Pull Request * Adds an alert in the themes that require an update to allow the users to update the outdated Themes. The number in the badge in the sidebar menu would inform the number of Themes that need to be updated, but the user could not take action to update it. #### Testing instructions * Go to the `Themes` under `Appearance`. * Click on `Install Theme` and upload an outdated theme, for example, https://downloads.wordpress.org/theme/storefront.4.0.0.zip * Then, you should see a badge with a number in the `Themes` menu. * Go to the `Themes` page again and select the `My Themes` tab, which should also contain the badge with the number. * You'll see the outdated themes with alerts, indicating that they need to be updated. * Click on the button `Update Theme`, and the numbers in the badges should decrease or disappear in case no theme requires an update Closes #62822

comment.body: Hey @SaxonF, do you have any thoughts about the design that we are implementing?

pull_request.title: My Jetpack: Licensing: Update href of view my plans button to go to Calypso Green
pull_request.body: #### Changes proposed in this Pull Request: * Updates location of "View my plans" button after activating a license to point to Calypso Green Before this PR, this button sent the user to the My Plan section in the Jetpack dashboard. But, in the case of attaching a license to a site that only has standalone plugins, and no Jetpack, this presents an issue. Of note, we are changing the behavior of the button to send the user outside of their site. This PR currently does not add the external icon. I'm not sure if this is necessary or not. #### Jetpack product discussion N/A #### Does this pull request change what data or activity we track or use? No #### Testing instructions: * Checkout branch * Go to cloud.jetpack.com/pricing and make a purchase of any Jetpack product, other than CRM or Search * After purchase, select configure manually at the bottom of the select and continue through until you can copy the license key * On Jetpack site, set `define( 'JETPACK_ENABLE_MY_JETPACK_LICENSE', true );` * Go to My Jetpack * Click on "Activate a license" link * Enter license * Click "View my plans" button * Ensure that you land on cloud.jetpack.com and can see your purchases * Try the above with/without Jetpack installed A screenshot of the success sce A screenshot of the purchases page in Calypso Green.

pull_request.title: Add editor wizard modal for courses and lessons
pull_request.body:
Fixes #5125

### Changes proposed in this Pull Request

* It removes `_needs_template` logic (old logic to add template when created through Course Outline).
* It removes Learning Mode onboarding.
* It adds a modal when creating new Courses and Lessons (it also applies to lessons created dynamically through the Course Outline).
* This PR doesn't add styles to the modal. I'm leaving it to the "steps" issues.
* It refactors the message we show to the user when adding/removing Sensei blocks to the post editor. Discussion: p1652822680825379-slack-C07418EJ0
* The Sensei Pro product tour will also be removed as part of another PR in Sensei Pro.

### Testing instructions

<!--
If the functionality of this PR is behind a feature flag, please include the
following testing step, using the correct name for the feature flag. (If you
aren't sure, just ignore this step)

* Enable the feature flag: `add_filter( 'sensei_feature_flag_{THE_FLAG_NAME}', '__return_true' );`
-->
* Clear the Local Storage.
* If you're using a more recent version of Gutenberg, remove user meta `wp_persisted_preferences` ([more details](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/commit/d7c18ee5ea1f1b2014e66d14f56b00a16f697caf)).
* Create a new Course, and a new Lesson through the "New Course" and "New Lesson" buttons in their respective sections under WP Admin. Make sure you see a modal when creating them. Also, make sure that they don't conflict with the Gutenberg blocks modal from the core (our modal is just displayed after closing the Gutenberg modal).
* Close the modal, save the post, and refresh the page. Make sure the modal doesn't appear again.
* Now, create a lesson through the Course Outline.
* Edit the lesson, and make sure the modal is displayed.
* Close the modal, and make sure it adds the default blocks template to the Lesson.
* Save the post, refresh the page, and make sure the modal isn't displayed again.

<!--
Helpful tips for screenshots:
https://en.support.wordpress.com/make-a-screenshot/
-->
### Screenshot / Video

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/876340/168915458-cbbc6f1a-0658-41b9-baf7-e8c8c91e22d9.mp4

pull_request.title: Social: Add toggle to enable or disable Publicize
pull_request.body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->
<!-- Would you like this feature to be tested by Beta testers?
Please add testing instructions to projects/plugins/jetpack/to-test.md in a new commit as part of your PR. -->
<!-- a12s: If you have an expected version that you're aiming for the PR to add, please use the Milestone field to communicate it. If you leave it blank, that indicates there isn't a preference. -->

This PR adds a simple toggle to enable or disable the Publicize module from Jetpack Social's admin page.

#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:
<!--- Explain what functional changes your PR includes -->
* Add a toggle to enable or disable Publizice.
* Add a store to the plugin, and refactor the connections list to use this store.
* Add endpoints to update Jetpack (module) settings.
* Add functions to the `api` package to fetch and update Jetpack Social settings.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1713699/166208577-e795526d-bf61-4f8c-a0f8-29af1576262c.mp4


#### Jetpack product discussion
<!-- If you're an Automattician, include a shortlink to the p2 discussion with Jetpack Product here. -->
<!-- Make sure any changes to existing products have been discussed and agreed upon -->

#### Does this pull request change what data or activity we track or use?
<!--- If so, please add the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label and explain what changes there are. -->
<!--- Check existing Jetpack support documents for a preview of the information we need. -->
No.

#### Testing instructions:
<!-- If you were reviewing this PR, how would you like the instructions to be presented? -->
<!-- Please include detailed testing steps, explaining how to test your change. -->
<!-- Bear in mind that context you working on is not obvious for everyone.  -->
<!-- Adding "simple" configuration steps will help reviewers to get to your PR as quickly as possible. -->
<!-- "Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual. -->

(see video for demonstration)

* Go to the Jetpack Social admin page.
* Confirm the current status of the module by running `jetpack docker wp option get jetpack_active_modules`.
* Use the toggle to enable or disable Publicize, and ensure the change went through by running the command again.
* Refresh the page with either the module enabled or disabled, and ensure the toggle is properly enabled or disabled.
* If you have access to a sandbox, check that the `active_modules` setting is synced correctly.

pull_request.title: Social: Add toggle to enable or disable Publicize
pull_request.body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->
<!-- Would you like this feature to be tested by Beta testers?
Please add testing instructions to projects/plugins/jetpack/to-test.md in a new commit as part of your PR. -->
<!-- a12s: If you have an expected version that you're aiming for the PR to add, please use the Milestone field to communicate it. If you leave it blank, that indicates there isn't a preference. -->

This PR adds a simple toggle to enable or disable the Publicize module from Jetpack Social's admin page.

#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request:
<!--- Explain what functional changes your PR includes -->
* Add a toggle to enable or disable Publizice.
* Add a store to the plugin, and refactor the connections list to use this store.
* Add endpoints to update Jetpack (module) settings.
* Add functions to the `api` package to fetch and update Jetpack Social settings.


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1713699/166208577-e795526d-bf61-4f8c-a0f8-29af1576262c.mp4


#### Jetpack product discussion
<!-- If you're an Automattician, include a shortlink to the p2 discussion with Jetpack Product here. -->
<!-- Make sure any changes to existing products have been discussed and agreed upon -->

#### Does this pull request change what data or activity we track or use?
<!--- If so, please add the "[Status] Needs Privacy Updates" label and explain what changes there are. -->
<!--- Check existing Jetpack support documents for a preview of the information we need. -->
No.

#### Testing instructions:
<!-- If you were reviewing this PR, how would you like the instructions to be presented? -->
<!-- Please include detailed testing steps, explaining how to test your change. -->
<!-- Bear in mind that context you working on is not obvious for everyone.  -->
<!-- Adding "simple" configuration steps will help reviewers to get to your PR as quickly as possible. -->
<!-- "Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual. -->

(see video for demonstration)

* Go to the Jetpack Social admin page.
* Confirm the current status of the module by running `jetpack docker wp option get jetpack_active_modules`.
* Use the toggle to enable or disable Publicize, and ensure the change went through by running the command again.
* Refresh the page with either the module enabled or disabled, and ensure the toggle is properly enabled or disabled.
* If you have access to a sandbox, check that the `active_modules` setting is synced correctly.

issue.title: Gutenberg Query Loop Block Ignoring Category Filters

labels.name: User Report
labels.description: This issue was created following a WordPress customer report

issue.body:
### Quick summary

When a user is in editor mode and adding the Query Loop Block, they are able to filter blog posts by category. The filter appears correct in editor but shows all posts (without the filter) on the live and updated page.

In editor:
![QueryLoop1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97132910/168933199-e08ce81c-3aa9-4313-bc8d-43192c7f3009.png)

Live site:
![queryloop2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/97132910/168933359-5ef6bd89-fd17-4bbf-8ebe-3ed6015447e2.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a page and add the Query Loop Block
2. Add a filter using blog categories
3. Update and save page
4. Check posts displayed in editor vs posts displayed on live updated page

### What you expected to happen

You expect the posts to be filtered by category. You expect what is seen on the page editor to be visualized on live site page.

### What actually happened

Posts are not filtered. Editor displays filtered posts, live site does not.

### Context

Customer report here in Chat transcript: 35526823-chat
Please notify user when bug is resolved.

Gutenberg Repo Issue:  https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/issues/41067

### Simple, Atomic or both?

Simple, Atomic

### Theme-specific issue?

_No response_

### Browser, operating system and other notes

_No response_

### Reproducibility

Consistent

### Severity

All

### Available workarounds?

_No response_

### Workaround details

_No response_

pull_request.title: Agencies: Add an empty signup route in the development env
pull_request.body:
#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request

* Add an empty /agency/signup route in the development env

#### Testing instructions

* Checkout PR and run Jetpack Cloud.
* When logged out, visit http://jetpack.cloud.localhost:3000/agency/signup and confirm you are redirected to log in.
* When logged in, visit http://jetpack.cloud.localhost:3000/agency/signup and confirm you are presented with an almost blank page.

![jetpack cloud localhost_3000_agency_signup(iPad Mini)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22746396/168287778-0c947bc0-de59-4129-b050-71546ec9a34a.png)

issue.title: "MongoClient must be connected to perform this operation"
issue.body:
<!-- *Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of mongoose -->
I am using latest version of mongoose 6.3.3

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
Bug
**What is the current behavior?**
MongoNotConnectedError","message":"MongoClient must be connected to perform this operation"
I am getting this issue while try to run project
**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**
While i am trying to run test cases i am getting this issue. Not at build time.

{"name":"MongoNotConnectedError","message":"MongoClient must be connected to perform this operation"}: expected { Object (_events, _eventsCount, ...) } to have status code 204 but got 400

comment.body: What does your test environment look like? Are you connecting to the mongoclient while testing?

issue.title: Allow merchant to set store logo on Platform Checkout settings
issue.body:
Fixes #4257

#### Changes proposed in this Pull Request

* Add a new file field on Platform Checkout settings that updates merchant store logo.

<!--
Title: A descriptive, yet concise, title.
-->

<!--
Description: Write a brief summary about this PR. As you compose your summary, consider each of these questions and address them if appropriate. Why is this change needed? What does this change do? Were there other solutions you considered? Why did you choose to pursue this solution? Describe any trade-offs you might have had to make.
-->

<!--
Questions for PR author:
- How can this code break?
- What are we doing to make sure this code doesn't break?
-->

<!--
Images or gifs: Include before and after screenshots or gifs/videos when it makes sense.
-->

#### Testing instructions

<!--
Testing instructions: How should this be tested and how can a reviewer test the end-user functionality? Are there known issues that you plan to address in a future PR? Are there any side effects that readers should be aware of?
-->

<!--
Add as many details as possible to help others reproduce the issue and test the fix.
"Before / After" screenshots can also be very helpful when the change is visual.
-->

* Access WCPay settings.
* On Platform Checkout, click on `Customize`.
* On Store logo section, click `Upload custom logo`.
* After upload finish, click `Save changes`.
* Reload the page, it should be persisted.

-------------------

- [x] Run `npm run changelog` to add a changelog file, choose `patch` to leave it empty if the change is not significant. You can add multiple changelog files in one PR by running this command a few times. 
- [x] Covered with tests (or have a good reason not to test in description ☝️)
- [ ] Tested on mobile (or does not apply)

**Post merge**

<!--
Make sure you edit the page for the current release when adding testing instructions.
We often create a blank page ahead of time for the next release.
If this PR need not be QA tested, edit to 'QA Testing Not Applicable'
-->

- [ ] Link to testing instructions from [release testing doc](https://github.com/Automattic/woocommerce-payments/wiki/Release-testing-instructions) following [these instructions](https://github.com/Automattic/woocommerce-payments/wiki/How-to-write-good-manual-testing-scenarios) : _Add link here / 'QA Testing Not Applicable'_
